parameters.definition: Processing rate of a cash-based machine (people per hour)
Processing rate of a card-only machine (people per hour)
Paper rolls needed per hour by a cash-based machine
Paper rolls needed per hour by a card-only machine
Minimum total processing capacity required (people per hour)
Maximum total paper rolls allowed per hour

description: An amusement park is installing ticket machines, both cash-based and card-only machines. A cash-based machine can process \param{RateCash} people per hour while a card-only machine can process \param{RateCard} people per hour. The cash-based machine needs \param{PaperCash} rolls of paper per hour while the card-only machine requires \param{PaperCard} rolls of paper per hour. The amusement park needs to be able to process at least \param{MinPeople} people per hour but can use at most \param{MaxPaper} rolls of paper per hour. Since most people prefer to pay by cash, the number of card-only machines must not exceed the number of cash-based machines. How many of each machine should be bought to minimize the total number of machines in the park?
